China's GDP growth slowed in the second quarter to 7.5 percent -- its weakest pace since 1991. Chen Liu, deputy director of the Economist Intelligence Unit in Beijing, joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.

"}]
description: China's GDP growth slowed in the second quarter to 7.5 percent -- its weakest pace since 1991.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, July 15, 2013
contentencoded: China's GDP growth slowed in the second quarter to 7.5 percent -- its weakest pace since 1991. Chen Liu, deputy director of the Economist Intelligence Unit in Beijing, joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.
teaser: China's GDP growth slowed in the second quarter to 7.5 percent -- its weakest pace since 1991.
title: China's GDP growth slows to 7.5%
